page.title: 08ART, ECOLOGY, ENERGY IN DUNS
page.content: {ART & CRAFT}THRIVES. PROFESSIONAL & AMATEUR PAINTERS EXHIBIT ANNUALLY. CRAFTSMEN INCLUDE POTTERS, BASKET MAKERS, UPHOLSTERERS,LINO PRINTERS, STICK DRESSERS, WOOD CARVERS & TURNERS, JEWELLERS, KNITTERS & NEEDLE WOMEN. CRAFTS ARE EXHIBITED AT SHOWS. PHOTOGRAPHERS ALSO EXHIBIT. {WILDLIFE}ABOUNDS. NO RARE SPECIES ARE FOUND. UNSPRAYED HEDGEROWS HAVE WILD FLOWERS & WILD FRUIT IS PLENTIFUL. {CLIMATE}IS TEMPERATE. WINTER SNOW CAN BLOCK ROADS.{POLLUTION}IS NOT A PROBLEM. FARM CHEMICALS SOMETIMES AFFACT STREAMS. NO INDUSTRIAL POLLUTION EXISTS. IN {CONSERVATION} BORDER FARMERS WERE THE FIRST IN SCOTLAND TO RECONCILE TECHNIQUES WITH CONSERVATION & TO APPOINT A FULL TIME ADVISOR. THE ONLY NATURAL{FUEL}FOUND IS WOOD. FOSSIL FUELS & ELECTRICITY ARE USED. THERE ARE COAL & OIL DEPOTS.
